comments.text:
Mozilla's Mailman implementation sends Post by non-member to a members-only list to the list moderator for review.

Post by non-member to a members-only list should be discarded by default, (and sent an email to subscribe accordingly) or list administrators should be able to set this bit per list.
comments.raw_text:
Mozilla's Mailman implementation sends Post by non-member to a members-only list to the list moderator for review.

Post by non-member to a members-only list should be discarded by default, (and sent an email to subscribe accordingly) or list administrators should be able to set this bit per list.

Why are you requesting this? Spam? The best fix for spam runs is, IMO, bug 658972.

If we do this, at the very least, this setting needs to be per-list because e.g. the support lists have new posters all the time.

justdave: is it possible to send back a "please subscribe" message?

Gerv

there is a moderation option that will help you.  In the mailman administration you should be able to navigate Privacy Options-> Sender Filters.  Then change the following field to *reject*.

"Action to take for postings from non-members for which no explicit action is defined"

Im also happy to do this for you.  Just provide a list of lists.
